info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 7:08PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTH CENTRAL TAOS COUNTY THROUGH 745 PM MDT... At 707 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorms near Taos, moving slowly toward the east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Taos, Taos Pueblo, Ranchos De Taos, Talpa, Los Cordovas, El Prado and Shady Brook. This includes the following highways... Highway 64 between Mile Markers 245 and 262. State Road 518 between Mile Markers 60 and 72. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
